intro: Pimpinella hirtella, commonly known as hairy cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Pimpinella hirtella is characterized by its hairy stems and foliage, which give it its common name.
